revised_title: Investigating Assimilation Rates in Plant Leaves
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the rate of assimilation in plant leaves, specifically in Helianthus annuus, under natural conditions. They used the half-leaf dry-weight method to measure the rate of increase in dry weight and found that stomatal aperture plays a significant role in regulating the rate of assimilation. The results suggest that the earlier work on this topic had some errors, and the authors provide a more accurate method for measuring assimilation rates in plant leaves.
